text: Cardinal versus ordinal numbers Cardinal one two three four 1 2 3 4 Ordinal first second third fourth 1st 2nd 3rd 4th A cardinal numeral (or 'cardinal number word') is a part of speech used to count. Examples are the words one, two, three, and also compounds like three hundred and forty-two (Commonwealth English) or three hundred forty-two (American English). Cardinal numbers are definite numerals. They are related to ordinal numbers, such as first, second, third, etc. == Related pages == * Arity * Cardinal number for the related usage in mathematics == References == Category:Numerals
title: Cardinal numeral
